Authors: Yong Wang, Yun Geng, Xiu-Guo Zhang
Title:
Phylogenetic relationships among Alternaria and five related
genera inferred from multi-gene DNA sequence data
Abstract:
The Alternaria group refers to five genera with similar
development of conidia and conidiophores. However, the taxonomic status
of these genera remains controversial. To demonstrate the phylogenetic
relationships of these genera, five gene regions [Alternaria alternata
major allergen (Alt a 1), ï¢-tubulin, elongation factor 1ï¡ (EF-1ï¡),
glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase (gpd) and the second largest
subunits of RNA polymerase II (rpb2)] were sequenced. The phylogenetic
analyses have revealed that the Alternaria group is represented by two
clades. The Nimbya group indicated a distant relationship with other
species. Three Sinomyces species grouped into an independent clade. The
Alternaria genus was polyphyletic, and formed two mainly independent
clades. Embellisia was also not monophyletic but only four species
clustered together. The Ulocladium group included A. cheiranthi and E.
indefessa. The Sinomyces and Nimbya genera were monophyletic, while the
Alternaria species may be resolved as two genera. Meanwhile, the
taxonomic status of Embellisia and Ulocladium needs to be
revisited.
